paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive Partitions
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive partitions
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/movies  hdfs:///data/movies
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive partitions
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Hive Partitions and Bucketing 

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive Partitions
Objective: Become familiar with using Hive partitions
File locations: hostname:/tmp/movies hdfs:///data/movies
Successful outcome: Understanding hive partitions
Before you begin: N/A
Related lessons: Hive Partitions and Bucketing

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup
The setup may have been completed in a previous lab.

msg.data:
Setup

The setup may have been completed in a previous lab.

paragraphs.title: Retrieve the files from IMDb
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r /tmp/movies
mkdir -p /tmp/movies
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.basics.tsv.gz -O /tmp/movies/title.basics.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.crew.tsv.gz -O /tmp/movies/title.crew.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/name.basics.tsv.gz -O /tmp/movies/name.basics.tsv.gz
wget -nv https://datasets.imdbws.com/title.ratings.tsv.gz -O /tmp/movies/title.ratings.tsv.gz

paragraphs.title: Use gunzip to extract the files
Copy the data in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/movies
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/movies
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/movies/* /data/movies/

paragraphs.title: Create the movies database
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS movies CASCADE;

CREATE DATABASE movies;

USE movies;

-- Contains the following information for titles
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_title_stage (
                        tconst string,
                        titleType string,
                        primaryTitle string,
                        originalTitle string,
                        isAdult string,
                        startYear string,
                        endYear string,
                        runtimeMinutes string,
                        genres ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/movie_title_stage/';

-- Load data
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/data/movies/title.basics.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE movie_title_stage;

-- Remove header for movie_title
ALTER TABLE movie_title_stage SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");


-- Contains the information for directors and writers
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_crew_stage(
                        tconst string,
                        directors ARRAY<STRING>,
                        writers ARRAY<STRING>
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/movie_crew_stage/';

-- Load data movie_crew
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/data/movies/title.crew.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE movie_crew_stage;

-- Remove header for movie_crew
ALTER TABLE movie_crew_stage SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");

-- Contains the information for names
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE movie_crew_info_stage(
                        nconst string,
                        primaryName string,
                        birthYear string,
                        deathYear string,
                        primaryProfession ARRAY<STRING>,
                        knownForTitles ARRAY<STRING>
                        )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/movie_crew_info_stage/';

-- Load data movie_crew_info
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/data/movies/name.basics.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE movie_crew_info_stage;

-- Remove header for movie_crew_info
ALTER TABLE movie_crew_info_stage SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");


-- Ratings and vote information for titles
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE ratings_stage(
                        tconst string,
                        averageRting double,
                        numVotes int
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/ratings_stage/';


-- Load data ratings
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/data/movies/title.ratings.tsv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE ratings_stage;

-- Remove header for ratings
ALTER TABLE ratings_stage SET TBLPROPERTIES ("skip.header.line.count"="1");

msg.data:
We are going to use the new movie database and do a describe on the tables listed below

use movies;
describe movie_title;
describe movie_crew;
describe movie_crew_info;
describe ratings;

Also, try some queries on the tables for practice. Limit your data to 5 rows.

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create two views in the movies database.
Views
-- A view to show all types that are movies and release year.
-- A view to show movies that have been released after 2015. 

~~~
Create VIEW movie_year as
Select primaryTitle,startYear from movie_title where titletype="movie";

Create VIEW title_releases as
Select primaryTitle,startYear from movie_title where startYear>2015;



~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

msg.data:
We are going to create two views in the movies database.
Views
– A view to show all types that are movies and release year.
– A view to show movies that have been released after 2015.

Create VIEW movie_year as
Select primaryTitle,startYear from movie_title where titletype="movie";

Create VIEW title_releases as
Select primaryTitle,startYear from movie_title where startYear>2015;

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

We are going to create a materialized views in the movies database.
CREATE TRANSACTIONAL TABLE
MATERIALIZED VIEW
– Show all types that are movies and the release year.

%jdbc(hive_interactive)
CREATE TABLE movie_title_transaction STORED AS orc AS SELECT * FROM movie_title_stage;

ALTER TABLE movie_title_transaction SET TBLPROPERTIES ('transactional'='true');

CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW mv_movie_title
AS  SELECT primaryTitle,startYear FROM movie_title_transaction WHERE titletype="movie";

DESCRIBE FORMATTED movies.mv_movie_title;

ALTER MATERIALIZED VIEW movies.mv_movie_title REBUILD;

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.text:
%md
In a new paragraph show the materialied views in the movies database using the command below:
```console
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
show materialized views in movies;
```

paragraphs.title: 12 - Show the materialied views in the movies database

paragraphs.text:
%md
**Tip:** You can create a materialized view and store the data in Druid, using the Druid storage Handler

msg.data: Tip: You can create a materialized view and store the data in Druid, using the Druid storage Handler

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive materialized view.

paragraphs.title: 11 - Can you delete movie titles from the year 2000 and rebuild the materialized view?
paragraphs.text:
%md
The following code will produce an error because you cannot udpate or delete records in a view
```console
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Delete from mv_movie_title where startYear='2000'
```

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Cloudera Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Cloudera Community Connection (HCC) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Cloudera Apache Spark Docs - official Spark documentation.
  4. Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs - official Zeppelin documentation.
